definition: to keep up with the latest fashion
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi
bang (hair)/fashionable/mane

sentences.english: It was a lesson to me not to follow fads.
sentences.chinese: 這對我來說是個教訓，即不要趕時髦。

sentences.english: My wife likes to follow the fashion.
It is typical of BarCap, he says, to try to be unfashionable.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，刻意不趕時髦是巴克萊資本的典型風格。

sentences.english: Men should be stylish, not fashionable.
sentences.chinese: 男人應該有品位，但不應趕時髦。

sentences.english: I can't follow the fashions in the things I like or dislike.
sentences.chinese: 我不能在個人愛好的問題上趕時髦。

sentences.english: That girl is not a swinger.
Most such fashionistas go for cheap frames sold on the street.
sentences.chinese: 多數愛趕時髦的人都買街邊賣的便宜鏡框。

sentences.english: Flanders, since when do you like anything cool?
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭德，你什麼時候也開始趕時髦了？

sentences.english: Some own a cell phone simply to catch up with fashion.
sentences.chinese: 有些人買手機是爲了趕時髦。

sentences.english: The new generation is trendy and tech savvy .
sentences.chinese: 新生一代喜歡趕時髦，對高新產品也很在行。

sentences.english: Are they going toco-exist in parallel fashion?
sentences.chinese: 還是趕時髦地玩起平行世界？

sentences.english: He tries to avoid trendiness when he buys new clothes.
sentences.chinese: 買衣服時，他都儘量不趕時髦。
她在穿着打扮上從不趕時髦。

definition: to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
old school/conservative faction
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
red in the face/extremely angry
all roads lead to Rome/use different means to obtain the same result (idiom)
pinyin: tiao2 tiao2 da4 lu4 tong1 Luo2 ma3

definition: to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
video program
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
soft skin and tender flesh (idiom)/smooth-skinned
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
